Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of animal to left (hoofed hind legs, tail, and rump with added red remaining); incised blob rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 64, pl. 51, no. 226)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 221)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.229) (phase 3)
